newsitem.title: RUSSIA: SOCCER-RUSSIAN LEAGUE REJECTS MATCH-FIXING CLAIM.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-RUSSIAN LEAGUE REJECTS MATCH-FIXING CLAIM.

text.p: Russian officials on Monday dismissed allegations of match-fixing in a premier league game last week.

"The Expert Council has ruled that the materials in its possession do not give sufficient grounds for establishing that the match Zhemchuzhina-Chernomorets was fixed," the council said in a press statement.

The council studied reports by official observers at the July 23 match at Sochi, when the home side Zhemchuzhina won 3-1 over Chernomorets Novorossiisk, their long-time rivals from further along the Black Sea coast.
Zhemchuzhina coach Arsen Naidyonov had hotly denied the allegations and accused the soccer elite in Moscow of conspiring against provincial sides.
Rumours of match-fixing have long been rife in Soviet and now Russian soccer.
The league set up a special commission this year to deal with match-fixing allegations by reviewing video and other evidence. It has the power to instigate criminal proceedings.
